Articles.Content:
Hi,

Im experiencing extreme wobbeling on my 250t, 1300 Part Minmus Station since the 1.1.3 Update. On 1.1.2 it was perfectly stable and suited as intended for my interplanetar missions. But with the update the whole station starts to wobble like crazy after a few seconds and making it impossible to dock. I tried to fix this with a mod but the problem is persitend :\.

 

MFG muh0r

Few seconds after what? What mods does the station use? Can you post screenshots of it?

Remember that the general solution to prevent wobble is MOAR STRUTS (the EAS-4 strut connector especially, it is the KSP equivalent of duct tape)

Also, you can use the KAS mod's Eva Attachable Struts if you want to tighten the connections between individual modules of the station. If you don't want to relaunch the modules, you can use this in conjunction with KIS.
OP, check if this is connected.

23 hours ago, Kerbal101 said:

OP, check if this is connected.

The Station has 2 Landers with Landing gear but it makes no difference wheter they are docked or not.

 

On 24.8.2016 at 10:22 AM, TheDestroyer111 said:

Few seconds after what? What mods does the station use? Can you post screenshots of it?

Remember that the general solution to prevent wobble is MOAR STRUTS (the EAS-4 strut connector especially, it is the KSP equivalent of duct tape)

Also, you can use the KAS mod's Eva Attachable Struts if you want to tighten the connections between individual modules of the station. If you don't want to relaunch the modules, you can use this in conjunction with KIS.

It starts a few seconds (3-4) after the loading screen when i enter the station. I undocked some modules for better perfomance and hoped that it will fix the wobble Problem too, but it did not. When i disable SAS the wobbeling starts slower but its sill there. I have no mods installed expect kerbal joint reinforcement, but that mod does not help at all.

Here is a Screenshot of the Station> 

http://imgur.com/gallery/4TSmomC

Disable all torque wheels and see if the wobble persists. If that is the case, there is some part conflict in one of your modules.

Generally on a station you only need one big reaction wheel or RCS to move it, adding more control sources will only result in controls fighting each other and wobble through SAS action.

1 hour ago, Stoney3K said:

Disable all torque wheels and see if the wobble persists.

That, and make that reaction wheel close to part which controls the craft.  If it helps, you can try to toggle on some more reaction wheels. Also, make sure craft is not controlled from some radially attached part (like docked lander).
